Steve,

> I have found that I am able to use Textui ok, it is just Swingui that
> interacts with RMI.
>
That's exactly the problem Frank Sommers said he encountered when  
trying to test Jini stuff with JUnit -- the text runner could load  
classes dynamically across the net but not the swing runner.

http://www.artima.com/suiterunner/why2.html

Frank ended up using (and helping develop) SuiteRunner as his runner,  
which loads classes fine because we have a notion of a "runpath" that  
uses the classloader parent-delegation model rather than using an  
excluded.properties file. I'm curious if there's some way to tweak the  
excluded.properties file to get dynamic class loading to work. Please  
post here if you figure that out. Anyway, you also have the option of  
using SuiteRunner as your JUnit runner. It should load classes for RMI  
just fine.

http://www.artima.com/suiterunner/index.html

Bill

> I suspect that I should somehow change the file excluded.properties
> in junit.jar (like I had to for using Junit with Log4J) but I don't
> know what to edit it to!!!
>
> Steve.
